channel.title: INtopBackup
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from INtopBackup, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Spotify's Daniel Ek announces that he'll step aside as CEO
item.description: The founder of the world's biggest music streaming service says he'll remain at the company as Executive Chairman, and will be replaced by two co-CEOs...

item.title: A lawsuit tries to block the Trump administration's efforts to merge personal data
item.description: A class action lawsuit argues that the administration's efforts to combine databases of personal information on Americans violates privacy laws and th...

item.title: Pasta meals from Trader Joe's and Walmart may be linked to a deadly listeria outbreak
item.description: The USDA says the precooked pasta products, sold at Trader Joe's and Walmart, could be connected to a nationwide listeria outbreak that has killed fou...

item.title: Here's what a shutdown means for Smithsonian museums, memorials and the zoo
item.description: History tells us visitors will likely find shuttered doors at major cultural institutions. But they will also find plenty of alternatives.

item.title: Trump administration uses taxpayer dollars to blame Democrats for government shutdown
item.description: Federal employees across the government reported seeing similar messages. Experts say the messages may violate ethics laws meant to keep partisan poli...

item.title: Chinese woman convicted after 'world's biggest' bitcoin seizure
item.description: UK police seized crypto worth over £5bn from Zhimin Qian, who was known as 'the goddess of wealth'.

item.title: Iowa schools leader held by ICE steps down as he fights deportation
Neither party shows signs of avoiding government shutdown
item.description: The U.S. is just hours away from a potential government shutdown. Congressional leaders have so far failed to reach a government funding agreement. CB...

item.title: 800 FBI employees being separated from bureau, sources say
item.description: Sources tell CBS News that on Tuesday night, 800 FBI employees, including a few hundred agents, will be leaving the bureau. CBS News justice correspon...

item.title: South Africa's top diplomat in France found dead near Paris hotel
item.description: The circumstances around Nathi Mthethwa's death are being investigated by the French authorities.

item.title: US cities should be military training grounds, Trump tells generals
item.description: The US president warned military leaders of a "war from within", and signals they will be tasked with intervening.

item.title: Government faces midnight shutdown deadline as Senate votes
item.description: The Senate plans to vote for a House-passed bill to keep the government open, but Democrats remain opposed ahead of a midnight deadline. Follow live u...

item.title: Here are some effects of a government shutdown if Congress, Trump don’t reach a deal
item.description: The U.S. government is nearing a partial shutdown, with a range of effects on public services and the broader economy.

item.title: Victims of Michigan church shooting include a grandfather who was a Navy veteran
Feds accuse Zillow of paying Redfin $100 million to "stop competing"
item.description: The FTC alleges the online real estate firms agreed not to compete against each other in the market for placing rental housing ads.

item.title: Unpicking Trump's Gaza peace plan map
item.description: BBC Verify analyses President Trump’s peace plan for Gaza and what it means on the ground.

item.title: Bowen: Momentum is the strength of Trump's Gaza plan, but lack of detail is its weakness
item.description: The plan is a significant moment - but it lacks the nuts and bolts that determine whether diplomatic agreements hold together, or don't.

item.title: Nicole Kidman files for divorce from Keith Urban, citing "irreconcilable differences"
item.description: Nicole Kidman and Keith Urban have been married since 2006 and have two daughters together.
